instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3662: What is 820-3662? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the LED light in the screen of the device that allows you to see what is on the screen. When this is low or missing, the screen will be dim..
definitions.BKLT_EN_R: What is BKLT_EN_R? This signal enables backlight. Anytime you see a signal ending with “_EN” , that means this signal being present/high enables what it is referring to. This signal says “BKL” before “_EN”. “BKL” sounds short for “BACKLIGHT”, so it is safe to assume this signal enables backlight when present. The “_R” suffix means that the signal is asserted when it is high, as in 3.3v, which is the opposite of the “_L”  suffix.
definitions.LCDBKLT_EN_L: What is LCDBKLT_EN_L? This signal enables the backlight when it is low.  _L means the signal asserts itself when the voltage is low. This signal needs to be low to enable backlight. .
definitions.PPBUS_SW_LCDBKLT_PWR: What is PPBUS_SW_LCDBKLT_PWR? PPBUS_SW_LCDBKLT_PWR is PPBUS_G3H after it has passed through a backlight fuse and a transistor that allows power through when BKLT_PLT_RST_L and LCD_BKLT_EN are present. .
definitions.Q7706: What is Q7706? Q7706 takes PPBUS_G3H's main 12.6v and sends it through to the backlight circuit. If Q9706 is not allowing PPBUS_G3H through, you will get no voltage on the backlight circuit. Q7706 is a P channel MOSFET, meaning power will flow through it when the voltage on the gate is lower than on the source. Look at pin 3. R7788 takes the 12.6v that is on the source and places it right on pin 3. This will set Q7706 to "off", and not allow it to pass power, as the voltage on the source and the gate are identical..

threads.title: another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight after liquid on lvds connecor
threads.message:
hello, need some help on this machine.

working so far so good, I can see everthing with a flashlight behind the LCD.

found red point under lvds connector, else white points everythere and board is looking good condition




the backlight pin on J8300 Pin 1 is away, replaced J8300 and a little jumpwire from pin 1 to net <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL>

but still no backlight

tested:

F7700 good, both pins 11.8V

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_SW_LCDBKLT_PWR</SIGNAL> = 11.82V
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_SW_BKL</SIGNAL> = 0V

<SIGNAL>LCDBKLT_EN_L</SIGNAL> = 11.8V

<RESISTOR>R7701</RESISTOR> = 80.5K
<RESISTOR>R7702</RESISTOR> = 64.5K

should be ok

<SIGNAL>BKLT_EN_R</SIGNAL> (pin17 <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>) = 3.3V

<CHIP>U7701</CHIP> pin 18 and pin 5 both 5.05V


<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> = 3.42V


Display from known working MacBook Pro 13 inch Retina Core i5 (Mid 2014) same result, a picture to see with a lamp behind the lcd


would u suggest to replace U 7701?


on <RESISTOR>R7758</RESISTOR>/57  i can see on the scope a data and a clock signal

threads.title: another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight after liquid on lvds connecor
threads.message: Check resistance between ground and pin 1 on j8300 and are traces from pins 3, 4 and 5 OK?...

threads.title: another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight after liquid on lvds connecor
threads.message: No, no need to replace <TRANSISTOR>Q7706</TRANSISTOR> if it isn't being told to open. Are you testing with a known good 2014 screen and cable (plugged in of course)? <RESISTOR>R7757</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R7758</RESISTOR> ok?

threads.title: another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight after liquid on lvds connecor
threads.message:
[USER="732"]peterfixit[/USER] , no hole there, pin 1 is the trace burned, LVDS connector was 1. thing i replaced

[USER="316"]G.Beard[/USER], no short from pin 1 to ground measured now in diode mode red on gnd 1.085, traces from pin 3 and 4 are ok

[USER="726"]jason_microsoldering[/USER], i dont want replace <TRANSISTOR>Q7706</TRANSISTOR> I ask to replace <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>?, Display from known working MacBook Pro 13 inch Retina Core i5 (Mid 2014) same result, a picture to see with a lamp behind the lcd, on <RESISTOR>R7758</RESISTOR>/57 i can see on the scope a data and a clock signal

that <SIGNAL>LCDBKLT_EN_L</SIGNAL> shold not be more than 3.3V, [USER="21"]appleonarim[/USER]  had here the same problem he had 12V, I have 11.8V. but the threat is without soulution

threads.title: another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight after liquid on lvds connecor
threads.message:
Good screen connected right?

I never bother to figure out what is wrong with backlight, I just replace everything that could have been affected by the short and get it out the door..... Sure it's the monkey no brain way of doing it but I really don't care because it works every time and I get paid for my 5 minutes.

5V on 30,29,28 J8300?
<RESISTOR>R7757</RESISTOR>/8 both 0Ohms?
<RESISTOR>R7708</RESISTOR>/09 good? 

Replaced <CAPACITOR>C8354</CAPACITOR>/5... Just because they are close to fucked up burns on old J8300.
Check <RESISTOR>R7721</RESISTOR>/22?

<CHIP>U7750</CHIP> OK?
Did you replace <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>?

threads.title: another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight after liquid on lvds connecor
threads.message: Wait, you are using a 13" display on a 15" board?? Are you sure that works?

threads.title: another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight after liquid on lvds connecor
threads.message: That I've been told a 13"  screen will not work on a 15" machine. i would suggest going over the pinned post on back light issues even thought its not a macbook air.

threads.title: another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight after liquid on lvds connecor
threads.message: first think i would check is voltage on L7710. if pin 17 is ok and pin 5, pin 18 are all present then no boosting is happening on pin 2 of of L7710, then change <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>. please report back these voltages first.

threads.title: another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight after liquid on lvds connecor
threads.message:
yes, i tried the 15" on the 13" and the 13" on the 15" nothing is working, so i am shure its not compatible.
pin 5: 5.05V
pin 17: 3.3V
pin 18: 5.05.V

L7710 pin 2 nothing is happening

the problem is i cant test if the screen or the cable has a problem.

i will report back how that case is ending soon
